snippet: Substandard and fake drugs are worsening the TB problem in many poor nations, and a new study urges countries to adopt a W.H.O. regimen to ensure quality.
abstract: Study in journal PLoS Medicine reports that substandard tuberculosis drugs sold by pharmacies in poor countries are growing public health threat, but that problem can be alleviated if governments enforce World Health Organization standards.
lead_paragraph: Substandard and fake drugs are worsening the TB problem in many poor nations, and a new study urges countries to adopt a W.H.O. regimen to ensure quality.

headline.main: Spurious Tuberculosis Drugs Pose a Threat
headline.print_headline: Spurious TB Drugs Pose a Threat
